meanings.definition: The quality or state of being fit for safe flight.
meanings.sent1: The airworthiness of the plane was confirmed before takeoff.
meanings.sent2: Pilots must ensure the airworthiness of their aircraft before every flight.
meanings.sent3: The clown's tiny car was questioned for its airworthiness by the circus safety inspector.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence in her own airworthiness as a pilot soared after passing the test.
meanings.sent5: The old biplane's airworthiness was questionable, but it still managed to take to the skies.

meanings.definition: The ability of an aircraft to meet safety standards and regulations.
meanings.sent1: The new regulations aim to improve the airworthiness of all commercial planes.
meanings.sent2: Inspectors check the airworthiness of aircraft to ensure passenger safety.
meanings.sent3: The penguin airline had to prove the airworthiness of their flying fish plane to skeptical passengers.
meanings.sent4: The airworthiness of the fighter jet was unmatched, making it a top choice for the air force.
meanings.sent5: The airworthiness of the helicopter was put to the test during the storm, proving its reliability in harsh conditions.
